creator: thim@brtek.com
text:
NullPointerException thrown when calling getRemoteUser() method on the 
HttpServletRequest object while using JDBCRealm.  The method call was made 
before the authentication took place.  The FORM method was specified as the 
authentication method.

In reviewing the code, the JDBCRealm class's authenticate(username, password) 
method does not check for null conditions on either the username or password 
arguments.  These arguments may have null values when the credentials hashtable 
does not get populated with those values (e.g., when the user has not yet 
logged in).

FYI, the following is the reported exception and stack trace:
Service exception encountered.java.lang.NullPointerException
Stack Trace:java.lang.NullPointerException
	at sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcPreparedStatement.setChar
(JdbcOdbcPreparedStatement.java:1193)
	at sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcPreparedStatement.setString
(JdbcOdbcPreparedStatement.java:574)
	at org.apache.tomcat.request.JDBCRealm.authenticate(JDBCRealm.java:306)
	at org.apache.tomcat.request.JDBCRealm.authenticate(JDBCRealm.java:482)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.doAuthenticate
(ContextManager.java, Compiled Code)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.RequestImpl.getRemoteUser
(RequestImpl.java:341)
        ...

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
